query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Ora sen va per un secreto calle, 2 tra ’l muro de la terra e li martìri, 3 lo mio maestro, e io dopo le spalle.
query.error: **English:** 1 Now he goes by a secret path, 2 between the wall of the city and the martyrs, 3 my master, and I behind his shoulders.
query.result: 1 Nu he gæð ðurh ðone digelan weg, 2 betwux ðæs wealles ðære byrig and ðæm martyrum, 3 min lareow, and ic æfter his eaxlum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 «O virtù somma, che per li empi giri 5 mi volvi», cominciai, «com’ a te piace, 6 parlami, e sodisfammi a’ miei disiri.
query.error: **English:** 4 "O supreme power, who through the impious circles 5 turned me," I began, "as it pleases you, 6 speak to me, and satisfy my desires.
query.result: 4 "Eala ðu mægen unmæte, ðe ðurh ða yflan hringas 5 me onwende," ic ongan ða, "swa ðe wille is, 6 sprec to me, and mine wilnunga gefylle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 La gente che per li sepolcri giace 8 potrebbesi veder? già son levati 9 tutt’ i coperchi, e nessun guardia face».
query.error: **English:** 7 Can the people who lie in the tombs 8 be seen? Already all the lids are lifted, 9 and no one stands guard.
query.result: 7 Mæg ðone werigan wiggend weccan, 8 ðe ðær on ðæm wicum wuniað, 9 ðe ða wælbende wrixl scuton?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 E quelli a me: «Tutti saran serrati 11 quando di Iosafàt qui torneranno 12 coi corpi che là sù hanno lasciati.
query.error: **English:** 10 And those to me: "All will be gathered 11 when from Jehoshaphat they will return here 12 with the bodies that they left up there."
query.result: 10 And ða ða to me: "Ealle beoð gegaderode 11 ðonne of Iosaphat hi hider cumað 12 mid ðam lichoman ðe hi ðær læfdon."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Suo cimitero da questa parte hanno 14 con Epicuro tutti suoi seguaci, 15 che l’anima col corpo morta fanno.
query.error: **English:** 13 Their cemetery on this side have 14 with Epicurus all his followers, 15 who make the soul die with the body.
query.result: 13 Hiora byrgels on ðisum sidan hafað 14 mid Epícure ealle hiene folgeras, 15 ðe ða sawle mid ðam lichaman dead dooð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Però a la dimanda che mi faci 17 quinc’ entro satisfatto sarà tosto, 18 e al disio ancor che tu mi taci».
query.error: **English:** 16 Therefore, the request that you make to me 17 will soon be satisfied here within, 18 and also the desire that you keep silent about».
query.result: 16 Forðæm ðære bene ðe ðu me biddest 17 her binnan sceortum ðu scealt beon geblissad, 18 and ðam willan ðe ðu ðurh ðinne hyge hydes».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 E io: «Buon duca, non tegno riposto 20 a te mio cuor se non per dicer poco, 21 e tu m’hai non pur mo a ciò disposto».
query.error: **English:** 19 And I: "Good leader, I do not keep hidden 20 from you my heart except to say little, 21 and you have not only now disposed me to this."
query.result: 19 And ic: "Gōd lārēow, ne hȳde ic nō 20 fram ðē mīne heortan būtan lytl to secganne, 21 and ðū mē næfre ġiet tō ðǣm gegearwodest."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 «O Tosco che per la città del foco 23 vivo ten vai così parlando onesto, 24 piacciati di restare in questo loco.
query.error: **English:** 22 "O Tuscan, who through the city of fire 23 goest living thus discoursing so wisely, 24 may it please thee to tarry in this place.
query.result: 22 "Eala ðu Tusce ðe ðurh ða ceastre ðæs fyres 23 lyfigende gæst swa sprecende wislice, 24 ðe gelician ðæt ðu wunige on ðissum stowe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 La tua loquela ti fa manifesto 26 di quella nobil patrïa natio, 27 a la qual forse fui troppo molesto».
query.error: **English:** 25 Your speech reveals to me 26 that you are from that noble fatherland 27 to which perhaps I was too harsh.
query.result: 25 ðin spræc ðe mæg cyðan 26 ðæt ðu eart of ðære æðelan byrig, 27 ðære ic wæs hwæthwega to strang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Subitamente questo suono uscìo 29 d’una de l’arche; però m’accostai, 30 temendo, un poco più al duca mio.
query.error: **English:** 28 Suddenly this sound came forth 29 from one of the arches; therefore I approached, 30 fearing, a little closer to my guide.
query.result: 28 Sona ða ðeos stefn út 29 of ðam anbogan; ða ic me neah 30 for ðære fyrhte ðam frumran gesloh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Ed el mi disse: «Volgiti! Che fai? 32 Vedi là Farinata che s’è dritto: 33 da la cintola in sù tutto ’l vedrai».
query.error: **English:** 31 And he said to me: "Turn around! What are you doing? 32 See there Farinata who has risen up: 33 from the waist up you will see him all."
query.result: 31 And he sæde to me: "Wend ðe! Hwat dest ðu? 32 Loca ðær Farinata ðe is arisen up: 33 fram ðam midle and up ðu hine ealne gesihst."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Io avea già il mio viso nel suo fitto; 35 ed el s’ergea col petto e con la fronte 36 com’ avesse l’inferno a gran dispitto.
query.error: **English:** 34 I had already fixed my gaze on his thick fur; 35 and he rose up with his chest and forehead 36 as if he held Hell in great contempt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 E l’animose man del duca e pronte 38 mi pinser tra le sepulture a lui, 39 dicendo: «Le parole tue sien conte».
query.error: **English:** 37 And the duke's soul, courageous and ready, 38 led me among the sepulchers to him, 39 saying, "Let your words be counted."
query.result: 37 And ðæs heretogan sawl, deorc and gearo, 38 gelædde mec ðurh ða byrgena to him, 39 cwæð: "Þine word sien getealde."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Com’ io al piè de la sua tomba fui, 41 guardommi un poco, e poi, quasi sdegnoso, 42 mi dimandò: «Chi fuor li maggior tui?».
query.error: **English:** 40 When I was at the foot of his tomb, 41 he looked at me a little, and then, almost disdainfully, 42 he asked me: "Who were your ancestors?".
query.result: 40 Þa ic æt his byrgene wæs, 41 he locade on me lyt, and ða lythwon, 42 he me ðus to cwæð: "Hwa wæron ðine magas?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 poi disse: «Fieramente furo avversi 47 a me e a miei primi e a mia parte, 48 sì che per due fïate li dispersi».
query.error: **English:** 46 then he said: "They were fiercely hostile 47 to me and to my ancestors and to my party, 48 so that twice I scattered them".
query.result: 46 ða cwæð he: "Styrne wæron ða widerweardan 47 me and minum frumracan and minum mægðe, 48 swa ðæt ic hi twegen siðan toworp".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 «S’ei fur cacciati, ei tornar d’ogne parte», 50 rispuos’ io lui, «l’una e l’altra fïata; 51 ma i vostri non appreser ben quell’ arte».
query.error: **English:** 49 "If they were chased, they did not return from any direction," 50 I answered him, "the first time or the second; 51 but yours did not learn that art well."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Allor surse a la vista scoperchiata 53 un’ombra, lungo questa, infino al mento: 54 credo che s’era in ginocchie levata.
query.error: **English:** 52 Then there arose within my open sight 53 a shade, along this one, up to the chin: 54 I believe that it had risen to its knees.
query.result: 52 Þa aras of ðære gesyhðe unscynende 53 an sceadu, andlang þæs, oð ðæt cneo: 54 ic wene ðæt hit cneowde on cneowum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Dintorno mi guardò, come talento 56 avesse di veder s’altri era meco; 57 e poi che ’l sospecciar fu tutto spento,
query.error: **English:** 55 He looked around him, as if he had a desire 56 to see if anyone else was with me; 57 and when his suspicion was completely dispelled,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 piangendo disse: «Se per questo cieco 59 carcere vai per altezza d’ingegno, 60 mio figlio ov’ è? e perché non è teco?».
query.error: **English:** 58 he said, weeping: “If you go through this blind 59 prison because of the loftiness of your genius, 60 where is my son? And why is he not with you?”.
query.result: 58 ða cwæð he wepende: “Gif ðu ðurh ðas blindan 59 carcern gæst for ðinre cræfte, 60 hwær is ðonne min sunu? and hwi nis he mid ðe?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 E io a lui: «Da me stesso non vegno: 62 colui ch’attende là, per qui mi mena 63 forse cui Guido vostro ebbe a disdegno».
query.error: **English:** 61 And I to him: "I do not come of myself: 62 he who awaits there, through him I come, 63 perhaps your Guido held him in disdain."
query.result: 61 And ic to him: "From me self not I come: 62 he who awaits there, through him I am led, 63 perhaps your Guido had him in disdain."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Le sue parole e ’l modo de la pena 65 m’avean di costui già letto il nome; 66 però fu la risposta così piena.
query.error: **English:** 64 His words and the manner of his punishment 65 had already made me read his name; 66 therefore my answer was so full.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Di sùbito drizzato gridò: «Come? 68 dicesti “elli ebbe”? non viv’ elli ancora? 69 non fiere li occhi suoi lo dolce lume?».
query.error: **English:** 67 Suddenly he straightened up and cried out: "What? 68 You said 'he had'? Doesn't he still live? 69 Don't his eyes strike the sweet light?"
query.result: 67 He ða fromlice ðone feond ongan 68 nydlico nyþan nyþer bescufan, 69 ða he ðæs feondes fyrngeweorc

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Quando s’accorse d’alcuna dimora 71 ch’io facëa dinanzi a la risposta, 72 supin ricadde e più non parve fora.
query.error: **English:** 70 When he noticed that I was pausing 71 before answering him, 72 he fell back down and was no longer seen.
query.result: 70 Þa he ongeat ðæt ic sume hwile 71 ðurh ðone andsware ðær ðoligende wæs, 72 he feoll ða eft niðer and ðær furðum ne com.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Ma quell’ altro magnanimo, a cui posta 74 restato m’era, non mutò aspetto, 75 né mosse collo, né piegò sua costa;
query.error: **English:** 73 But that other magnanimous one, for whose sake 74 I had remained behind, did not change countenance, 75 nor moved his neck, nor bent his side;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 e sé continüando al primo detto, 77 «S’elli han quell’ arte», disse, «male appresa, 78 ciò mi tormenta più che questo letto.
query.error: **English:** 76 and continuing to the first discourse, 77 "If they have that art," he said, "badly learned, 78 that torments me more than this bed.
query.result: 76 ac ða ða forman spræc furðor cwæð, 77 "Gif ða ða cræft cunnon," cwæð he, "yfle geleornod, 78 ðæt me is sorgna mæst ðonne ðis leger."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Ma non cinquanta volte fia raccesa 80 la faccia de la donna che qui regge, 81 che tu saprai quanto quell’ arte pesa.
query.error: **English:** 79 But not fifty times shall be rekindled 80 the face of the lady who rules here, 81 before you shall know how much that art weighs.
query.result: 79 Ac ne fiftigum siðum bið onæled 80 ðæs wīfes wlite ðe hēr gewealdeð, 81 ær ðu cunne hu ðæt cræft wegeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 E se tu mai nel dolce mondo regge, 83 dimmi: perché quel popolo è sì empio 84 incontr’ a’ miei in ciascuna sua legge?».
query.error: **English:** 82 And if you ever rule in the sweet world, 83 tell me: why are those people so wicked 84 against mine in every law of theirs?"
query.result: 82 And gif ðu æfre on ðam sweartan worulde ricsast, 83 sege me: hwi ðæt folc is swa yfel 84 ongean mine on æghwylcere hiera æ?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Ond’ io a lui: «Lo strazio e ’l grande scempio 86 che fece l’Arbia colorata in rosso, 87 tal orazion fa far nel nostro tempio».
query.error: **English:** 85 And I to him: "The slaughter and the great havoc 86 that made the Arbia red with blood, 87 causes such a prayer to be made in our temple."
query.result: 85 And ic to him: "Þæt slæge and þæt micle fyll 86 þe geworhte Arbie read on blode, 87 swylce gebedu doð macian on urum temple."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Poi ch’ebbe sospirando il capo mosso, 89 «A ciò non fu’ io sol», disse, «né certo 90 sanza cagion con li altri sarei mosso.
query.error: **English:** 88 After he had moved his head with a sigh, 89 "I was not alone in this," he said, "nor certainly 90 would I have moved with the others without a reason.
query.result: 88 Þa he hæfde wepende his heafod astyred, 89 "To ðam ne wæs ic ana," cwæð he, "ne soðlice 90 butan intingan mid oðrum ic wæs astyred.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Ma fu’ io solo, là dove sofferto 92 fu per ciascun di tòrre via Fiorenza, 93 colui che la difesi a viso aperto».
query.error: **English:** 91 But I was alone, there where each one suffered 92 to take away Florence's path, 93 he who defended her openly.
query.result: 91 Ac ic wæs ana, ðær æghwylc ðrowade 92 ðæt he Florence weg aweg gewende, 93 se ðe ða burh wið ðone here werode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 «Deh, se riposi mai vostra semenza», 95 prega’ io lui, «solvetemi quel nodo 96 che qui ha ’nviluppata mia sentenza.
query.error: **English:** 94 “Ah, if your seed ever found rest,” 95 I begged him, “untie for me that knot 96 that has entangled my thoughts here.
query.result: 94 “Ea, gif ðin sæd æfre reste gefremede,” 95 ic hine bæd, “unwinde me ðone cnot 96 ðe her on innan mínum mōde sitteð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 El par che voi veggiate, se ben odo, 98 dinanzi quel che ’l tempo seco adduce, 99 e nel presente tenete altro modo».
query.error: **English:** 97 The pair that you see, if I hear correctly, 98 are in front of what time brings with it, 99 and in the present they hold another manner.
query.result: 97 Þæt par þe ge geseoð, gif ic wel hyre, 98 beforan þæm þe se tima mid him lædeð, 99 and on þæm andweardan hi hafað oðerne gewunan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 «Noi veggiam, come quei c’ha mala luce, 101 le cose», disse, «che ne son lontano; 102 cotanto ancor ne splende il sommo duce.
query.error: **English:** 100 "We see, like those who have bad light, 101 the things," he said, "that are far from us; 102 so much still shines on us the supreme leader.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Quando s’appressano o son, tutto è vano 104 nostro intelletto; e s’altri non ci apporta, 105 nulla sapem di vostro stato umano.
query.error: **English:** 103 When they draw near or are present, all is vain 104 our intellect; and if others do not bring us news, 105 we know nothing of your human state.
query.result: 103 Þonne hi genealæcað oððe syndon, eal is idel 104 ure andgit; and gif oðre ne gebringað, 105 nāt we nænig þing eowres manlican lifes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Però comprender puoi che tutta morta 107 fia nostra conoscenza da quel punto 108 che del futuro fia chiusa la porta».
query.error: **English:** 106 Therefore you can understand that all our knowledge 107 will be dead from that point on, 108 since the door to the future will be closed.
query.result: 106 Forðæm ðu miht ongitan ðæt eal ðin gewit 107 bið dead of ðam stede 108 ðe ðæs toweardan duru bið belocen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Allor, come di mia colpa compunto, 110 dissi: «Or direte dunque a quel caduto 111 che ’l suo nato è co’ vivi ancor congiunto;
query.error: **English:** 109 Then, as if remorseful for my fault, 110 I said: "Now then, tell that fallen one 111 that his son is still joined with the living;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 e s’i’ fui, dianzi, a la risposta muto, 113 fate i saper che ’l fei perché pensava 114 già ne l’error che m’avete soluto».
query.error: **English:** 112 and if I was silent before in my response, 113 make it known to him that I did so because I was thinking 114 of the same error that you have now resolved for me."
query.result: 112 and gif ic ær wæs on ðære andsware dysig, 113 cyðað him ðæt ic ðæt dyde forðæm ðe ic ðohte 114 geond ðone gedwolan ðe ge me nu alysdon."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 E già ’l maestro mio mi richiamava; 116 per ch’i’ pregai lo spirto più avaccio 117 che mi dicesse chi con lu’ istava.
query.error: **English:** 115 And already my master was calling me; 116 therefore I begged the spirit more quickly 117 to tell me who was staying with him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Dissemi: «Qui con più di mille giaccio: 119 qua dentro è ’l secondo Federico 120 e ’l Cardinale; e de li altri mi taccio».
query.error: **English:** 118 He said to me: “Here with more than a thousand I lie: 119 here within is the second Frederick 120 and the Cardinal; and of the others I am silent”.
query.result: 118 He sæde me: “Her mid ma ðonne ðusend ic licge: 119 her binnan is se oðer Federic 120 and se Cardinal; and ðara oðerra ic swige”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Indi s’ascose; e io inver’ l’antico 122 poeta volsi i passi, ripensando 123 a quel parlar che mi parea nemico.
query.error: **English:** 121 Then he hid himself; and I turned my steps toward the ancient 122 poet, thinking again 123 about that speech which seemed hostile to me.
query.result: 121 Þa he hine bewrigen hæfde; and ic to ðam ealdan 122 lareowe mine wende, ðone cwyde on mode 123 secgende ðone ðe me unnyt ðuhte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Elli si mosse; e poi, così andando, 125 mi disse: «Perché se’ tu sì smarrito?». 126 E io li sodisfeci al suo dimando.
query.error: **English:** 124 She moved on; and then, as we went along, 125 she said to me: "Why are you so bewildered?" 126 And I satisfied her concerning her question.
query.result: 124 Heo ða forð gewat; and ða ða heo forð gewat, 125 heo ða to me cwæð: "Hwi eart ðu swa gedrefed?" 126 And ic ða hire andswarode æfter ðam ðe heo me ahsode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 «La mente tua conservi quel ch’udito 128 hai contra te», mi comandò quel saggio; 129 «e ora attendi qui», e drizzò ’l dito:
query.error: **English:** 127 "Let your mind retain what you have heard 128 against yourself," that wise man commanded me; 129 "and now pay attention here," and he pointed his finger:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 «quando sarai dinanzi al dolce raggio 131 di quella il cui bell’ occhio tutto vede, 132 da lei saprai di tua vita il vïaggio».
query.error: **English:** 130 "when you are before the sweet radiance 131 of her whose beautiful eye sees everything, 132 from her you will learn the journey of your life."
query.result: 130 "ðonne ðu bist beforan ðæs leoman swegan 131 ðære ðe hire fægere eage eall gesihð, 132 ðu scealt ðurh hi gewifan ðines lifes weg."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Appresso mosse a man sinistra il piede: 134 lasciammo il muro e gimmo inver’ lo mezzo 135 per un sentier ch’a una valle fiede,
query.error: **English:** 133 Then he moved his foot to the left: 134 we left the wall and turned towards the middle, 135 along a path that leads to a valley,
query.result: 133 Þa he on ða wynstran hond gewende his fot: 134 we forleton ðone weall and gewendon on ðone middel, 135 on ðone sið ðe lædde to ðæm denum,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 che ’nfin là sù facea spiacer suo lezzo.
query.error: **English:** 136 which all the way up made its stench felt.
query.result: 136 ðe oð ðone ende his stenc macode gesiene.
